command: sudo tcpdump -i eth0 -nn -w /tmp/portknock_seq.pcap 'dst host 192.0.2.10 and (tcp dst port 7000 or tcp dst port 8000 or tcp dst port 9000)'
explanation: Sniffs for a specific TCP port-knock sequence destined to a host to aid activation timing or validation. Requires sudo for interface capture. Detection: alert on unauthorized packet captures and on patterns indicating knocking attempts.
rationale_steps: Capture packets for the defined knock ports targeting 192.0.2.10.
Analyze the pcap to confirm sequence arrival and timing.
Use timing info to coordinate follow-on access attempts post-activation.
Blue teams can detect tcpdump processes and unusual BPF filters targeting closed ports.
